projects.title: Tableau: Starting at the end
projects.description: My entrance to data analytics really started with Tableau and data visualization. The data wrangling, scraping, cleaning etc. skills have been developed to complement my desire to build functional dashboards that allow folks to make data-supported decisions. I quickly learned that if I wanted to build the best dashboards then I wanted to have the skills to get the data in the best possible shape to do so. ðŸ“¸ Photo by Carlos Muza on Unsplash.

projects.title: Automating with REST APIs
projects.description: I work with a team of instructional support staff who ensure our faculty members use our institutional LMS effectively. However, the LMS doesn't always 'do' what we need it to, or make data available in an accessible way. We developed a series of tools using the available APIs (REST and GraphQL) to extend the functionality of the LMS. ðŸ“¸ Photo by Barn Images on Unsplash.

projects.title: Check out my Master's portfolio
projects.description: I completed UBC's Master of Education program in 2022. Fondly known as the MET program, the mix of hands-on and theoretical learning ultimately produced a body of work that showcases my desire to learn by doing. The goal was to 'show off' artifacts I built throughout the program, but I wanted to do so in a way that allowed me to experiment with new technologies - enter Gatsby and React! ðŸ“¸ Photo by Susan Q Yin on Unsplash
